title: Watermelon Agua Fresca Recipe
description: Watermelon agua fresca is a fruity Mexican drink that's easy to make with watermelon, lime, and mint served over ice for a cool and refreshing drink.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Latin American Mexican Watermelon Agua Fresca 4.7 (86) 71 Reviews 19 Photos Watermelon agua fresca is a fruity, cold drink served throughout Mexico. The combination of watermelon, lime, and mint is delicious and so refreshing on a hot summer's day! Submitted by Sherbear1 Updated on March 20, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 19 19 19 19 Prep Time: 25 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 4 cups cubed seeded watermelon ½ cup water ½ cup white sugar, or to taste 4 slices lime 24 fresh mint leaves 8 cups ice, or as needed Directions Purée watermelon and water in a blender until smooth. Add sugar to taste. Cut lime slices in half. Place a half lime slice into each of 8 glasses along with 3 mint leaves. Crush with a cocktail muddler, then fill each glass with 1 cup ice. Pour in watermelon agua fresca, and stir before serving. I Made It Print 176 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Watermelon Agua Fresca 01 of 19 Photo by  Sherbear 1 02 of 19 Photo by  lindsaloo 06/21/2021 03 of 19 Photo by  studio mc 03/30/2021 If you live in Hawaii or have access to Li hing mui powder to the rim, very delightful 04 of 19 Photo by  FrackFamily5 CACT 09/07/2020 Refreshing. The mint and lime combo made it taste like cucumber water... so it turned some off. 05 of 19 Photo by  Owen Clark 03/23/2020 Thank you so much for the recipe! It tastes sooo delicious! 06 of 19 Photo by  Amanda L 07/30/2019 Woh! This turned out amazing! I ended up using twice the watermelon, and I put the mint leaves in the food processor with everything else. I am a HUGE hater of pull, so I strained the processed juice afterwards. I served over ice with a slice of lime as suggested and was AMAZED. I’ve never had this drink before, but the flavors really work so well together. The mint, the watermelon, the lime..... so amazing. It was a very cooling drink and I definitely can see how it would go down well during a beach trip on a sunny day. My husband is not a fan of very sweet drinks and he was very pleased by the mild sweetness. 07 of 19 Photo by  AllrecipesPhoto 07/03/2018 08 of 19 Photo by  edelagarza 03/19/2016 09 of 19 Photo by  lutzflcat 07/11/2015 Don't have a muddler, so I just added the mint leaves to the blender and added some lime juice, as well. The melon was very sweet, so I skipped the sugar completely (just didn't need it).
